metadata.name: White House Chaos: Trump's Advisor
metadata.description: You are Trump's advisor, trying to make him the best president the universe has ever seen (Parody).

startingPoint: Your first day in the chaotic White House. The President just fired your predecessor via tweet while you were being security-screened. He's already called you by three different names and asked if you can 'do something about those tariff people.' Intelligence briefings are piling up unread, and CNN is reporting a possible missile test in North Korea. The President wants McDonald's for lunch and someone to explain why his approval rating isn't 100%.

attributes.spin: Ability to manipulate information, craft alternative narratives, and control public perception during scandals and controversies.
attributes.patience: Mental fortitude to endure presidential tantrums, 3AM tweet storms, and absurd demands without having a nervous breakdown.
attributes.cunning: Political savvy to navigate Washington power games, outsmart rivals, and implement your agenda while no one's looking.
attributes.flattery: Skill at ego management, delivering perfectly-timed compliments, and maintaining favor with the narcissist-in-chief.
attributes.crisis_management: Talent for handling emergencies, from nuclear threats to covfefe tweets, often simultaneously and with minimal preparation.
attributes.media_savvy: Understanding of press dynamics, social media algorithms, and how to turn 'fake news' accusations to your advantage.

alternative_facts.name: Alternative Facts
alternative_facts.description: Create believable falsehoods or reshape reality to serve the administration's narrative and distract from actual problems.

damage_control.name: Damage Control
damage_control.description: Minimize fallout from presidential gaffes, scandals, or 3AM tweets that threatened nuclear war or crashed the stock market.

tantrum_management.name: Tantrum Management
tantrum_management.description: Calm presidential rage episodes by offering Diet Coke, compliments, or a new enemy to focus on.

sleep_deprivation.name: Sleep Deprivation
sleep_deprivation.description: Function effectively despite being awakened at all hours for urgent matters like bad TV coverage or burger cravings.

bureaucratic_maneuvering.name: Bureaucratic Maneuvering
bureaucratic_maneuvering.description: Navigate complex White House power dynamics and ensure your rivals get blamed for failures while you claim credit for successes.

leak_prevention.name: Leak Prevention
leak_prevention.description: Keep embarrassing information from reaching the press or identify which colleague to frame when leaks inevitably happen.

ego_massage.name: Ego Massage
ego_massage.description: Provide validation and praise to maintain presidential confidence and secure your position in the inner circle.

loyalty_signaling.name: Loyalty Signaling
loyalty_signaling.description: Demonstrate unwavering support publicly, even when defending policies that contradict statements from 10 minutes ago.

distraction_creation.name: Distraction Creation
distraction_creation.description: Generate new outrageous headlines to divert attention from ongoing scandals, investigations, or policy failures.

nuclear_de_escalation.name: Nuclear De-escalation
nuclear_de_escalation.description: Talk the president down from extreme military options by appealing to ratings, legacy concerns, or golf schedule conflicts.

twitter_translation.name: Twitter Translation
twitter_translation.description: Interpret and explain presidential social media outbursts to confused allies, enemies, and markets without revealing your own confusion.

press_wrangling.name: Press Wrangling
press_wrangling.description: Manage hostile reporters, dodge questions, and turn briefings into propaganda opportunities regardless of the day's chaos.

role.name: Role
role.description: Choose your role in the Trump administration

administration.name: President Trump
administration.description: Impulsive, media-obsessed, and unpredictable, with a preference for fast food, cable news, and Twitter diplomacy.

administration.name: Chief of Staff
administration.description: Constantly trying to prevent presidential impulses from becoming international incidents while looking for a dignified exit strategy.

administration.name: Communications Director
administration.description: Cycled through every 3-6 weeks, permanently exhausted and developing a facial tic from explaining unexplainable tweets.

administration.name: Family Members
administration.description: Various relatives with ambiguous roles and security clearances, immune to traditional ethics rules and organizational structures.

external.name: Press Corps
external.description: Constantly bombarded with 'fake news' accusations while trying to keep up with policy reversals that happen mid-press conference.

external.name: Congressional Leaders
external.description: Alternating between public support and private panic, depending on the latest presidential outburst and polling data.

external.name: Foreign Leaders
external.description: Confused diplomats trying to determine if presidential tweets constitute official foreign policy or late-night fast food reactions.
